Create balancing formulas

Source: R/createFormulas.R
createFormulas.Rd

Creates balancing formulas relating exposure to all relevant time-varying and time invariant confounders at each exposure time point to be used to create IPTW weights.

Usage

createFormulas(
  exposure,
  exposure_time_pts,
  outcome,
  type,
  ti_confounders,
  tv_confounders,
  bal_stats = NULL,
  concur_conf = NULL,
  keep_conf = NULL,
  home_dir = NULL,
  custom = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE,
  save.out = TRUE
)

Arguments

exposure

name of exposure variable

exposure_time_pts

list of integers at which weights will be created/assessed that correspond to time points when exposure wass measured

outcome

name of outcome variable with ".timepoint" suffix

type

type of formula to create from 'full' (includes all lagged time-varying confounders), 'short' (includes time-varying confounders at t-1 lag only), or 'update' (adds to 'short' formulas any imbalanced time-varying confounders at lags great than t-1)

ti_confounders

list of time invariant confounders (at least one required)

tv_confounders

list of time-varying confounders with ".timepoint" suffix, should include exposure and outcome variables (at least time-varying exposure variables required here)

bal_stats

list of balance statistics from assessBalance(), required for 'update' type

concur_conf

(optional) list of variable names reflecting time-varying confounders to retain in formulas contemporaneously (default is none)

keep_conf

(optional) list of variable names reflecting confounders to always retain in formulas (default depends on type)

home_dir

path to home directory (required if 'save.out' = TRUE)

custom

(optional) custom list of formulas at each exposure time point (default is to create automatically according to type)

verbose

(optional) TRUE or FALSE indicator for user output (default is TRUE)

save.out

(optional) TRUE or FALSE indicator to save output and intermediary output locally (default is TRUE)

Value

list of balancing formulas at each exposure time point

Examples

#Full Formulas
f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "full",
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the full balancing formula below:
#> The full formula for A - D.3 at A time point 1 is: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b14c4fd40>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the full balancing formula below:
#> The full formula for A - D.3 at A time point 2 is: 
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b14c4fd40>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the full balancing formula below:
#> The full formula for A - D.3 at A time point 3 is: 
#> A.3 ~ A.1 + A.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b14c4fd40>
#> 

f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3", "B.1", "B.2", "B.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "full",
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the full balancing formula below:
#> The full formula for A - D.3 at A time point 1 is: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b148e4ac8>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the full balancing formula below:
#> The full formula for A - D.3 at A time point 2 is: 
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + B.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b148e4ac8>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the full balancing formula below:
#> The full formula for A - D.3 at A time point 3 is: 
#> A.3 ~ A.1 + A.2 + B.1 + B.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b148e4ac8>
#> 

#Short Formulas
f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "short",
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the short balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 only:
#> The short formula for A - D.3 at A time point 1 is: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b146a19f0>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the short balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 only:
#> The short formula for A - D.3 at A time point 2 is: 
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b146a19f0>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the short balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 only:
#> The short formula for A - D.3 at A time point 3 is: 
#> A.3 ~ A.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b146a19f0>
#> 
f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3", "B.1", "B.2", "B.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "short",
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the short balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 only:
#> The short formula for A - D.3 at A time point 1 is: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b145b7068>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the short balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 only:
#> The short formula for A - D.3 at A time point 2 is: 
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + B.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b145b7068>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the short balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 only:
#> The short formula for A - D.3 at A time point 3 is: 
#> A.3 ~ A.2 + B.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b145b7068>
#> 

c <- list("short_form-1" = as.formula(A.1 ~ C),
          "short_form-2" = as.formula(A.2 ~ A.1 + B.1 + C),
          "short_form-3" = as.formula(A.3 ~ A.2 + B.2 + C))

f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3", "B.1", "B.2", "B.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "short",
                    custom = c,
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> The user-supplied custom balancing formula for each exposure time point are below: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b0daceb08>
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + B.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b0daceb08>
#> A.3 ~ A.2 + B.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b0daceb08>

#Update Formulas
test <- data.frame(ID = 1:50,
                   A.1 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   A.2 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   A.3 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   B.1 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   B.2 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   B.3 = rnorm(n = 50),
                   C = rnorm(n = 50),
                   D.3 = rnorm(n = 50))
test[, c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3")] <- lapply(test[, c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3")], as.numeric)

w <- createWeights(data = test,
                   exposure = "A",
                   outcome = "D.3",
                   formulas = f,
                   save.out = FALSE)
#> For the cbps weighting method, the median weight value is 0.93 (SD = 0.84; range = 0.41-6). 
#> 


b <- assessBalance(data = test,
                   exposure = "A",
                   exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                   outcome = "D.3",
                   type = "weighted",
                   weights = w,
                   formulas = f,
                   save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: The following statistics display covariate imbalance at each exposure time point following IPTW weighting, using short formulas.
#> 



#> As shown below, 3 out of 7 (43%) covariates across time points, corresponding to 3 out of 2 domains, remain imbalanced with a remaining median absolute value correlation/std mean difference of 0.17 (range= -0.16-0.21):
#> 
#> Table: Imbalanced covariates using cbps and short formulas
#> 
#> | exp_time| balanced_n| imbalanced_n|  n|
#> |--------:|----------:|------------:|--:|
#> |        1|          0|            1|  1|
#> |        2|          2|            1|  3|
#> |        3|          2|            1|  3|
#> 
#> 
#> USER ALERT: For exposure A using the short formulas and cbps :
#> The median absolute value relation between exposure and confounder is 0.07 (range = -0.16 -0.21). 
#> As shown below, the following 3 covariates across time points out of 7 total (42.86%) spanning 3 domains out of 3 (100%) are imbalanced with a remaining median absolute value correlation/std mean difference in relation to A of 0.17 (range=-0.16-0.21) :
#> 
#> 
#> Table: Imbalanced Covariates
#> 
#> |   |exposure | exp_time| covar_time|covariate |    avg_bal| bal_thresh| balanced|
#> |:--|:--------|--------:|----------:|:---------|----------:|----------:|--------:|
#> |1  |A        |        1|          0|C         |  0.2083261|        0.1|        0|
#> |2  |A        |        2|          1|A.1       | -0.1592468|        0.1|        0|
#> |6  |A        |        3|          2|B.2       |  0.1705310|        0.1|        0|
#> 
f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "update",
                    bal_stats = b,
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the updated balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 and those greater at further lags that remained imbalanced:
#> The update formula for A - D.3 at A time point 1 is: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b194935b8>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the updated balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 and those greater at further lags that remained imbalanced:
#> For A at exposure time point 2 no time-varying confounders at additional lags were added. 
#> 
#> The update formula for A - D.3 at A time point 2 is: 
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b194935b8>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the updated balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 and those greater at further lags that remained imbalanced:
#> For A at exposure time point 3 no time-varying confounders at additional lags were added. 
#> 
#> The update formula for A - D.3 at A time point 3 is: 
#> A.3 ~ A.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b194935b8>
#> 
f <- createFormulas(exposure = "A",
                    exposure_time_pts = c(1, 2, 3),
                    outcome = "D.3",
                    tv_confounders = c("A.1", "A.2", "A.3", "B.1", "B.2", "B.3"),
                    ti_confounders = "C",
                    type = "update",
                    bal_stats = b,
                    save.out = FALSE)
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the updated balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 and those greater at further lags that remained imbalanced:
#> The update formula for A - D.3 at A time point 1 is: 
#> A.1 ~ C
#> <environment: 0x555b19554960>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the updated balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 and those greater at further lags that remained imbalanced:
#> For A at exposure time point 2 no time-varying confounders at additional lags were added. 
#> 
#> The update formula for A - D.3 at A time point 2 is: 
#> A.2 ~ A.1 + B.1 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b19554960>
#> 
#> USER ALERT: Please manually inspect the updated balancing formula below that includes time-varying confounders at t-1 and those greater at further lags that remained imbalanced:
#> For A at exposure time point 3 no time-varying confounders at additional lags were added. 
#> 
#> The update formula for A - D.3 at A time point 3 is: 
#> A.3 ~ A.2 + B.2 + C
#> <environment: 0x555b19554960>
#>
